page.title: 17Changing role buildings.
page.content: Highcroft Hall is a typical example of how the function of a large manor type house has changed.Highcroft Hall was built in the 1870's for the lady-in-waiting of Princess Eugenie (the wife of Napolean III) in the style of a French chateau.The house was then sold to Edwin Vinson a wealthy local farmer,who introduced strawberries into Kent.He farmed a large area around Crockenhill and was a good employer.During this time the cedar tree which still stands today was thought to have been planted.The hall was used by American and Polish officers during WW2.The Hall then used a country club and today is a public house and restaurant.The present owners provide a number facilities for relaxation and entertainment including dancing,overnight accommodation,rooms for private functionsand a varied menu
